      • **vue.config.js**

        vue.config.jsÂ is an optional config file that will be automatically loaded byÂ @vue/cli-serviceÂ if it's present in your project root (next toÂ package.json). You can also use theÂ vueÂ field inÂ package.json, but do note in that case you will be limited to JSON-compatible values only.

        The file should export an object containing options:

If one of your dependencies need polyfills, you have a few options:

  1. If the dependency is written in an ES version that your target environments do not support:Â Add that dependency to theÂ [transpileDependencies](https://cli.vuejs.org/config/#transpiledependencies)Â option inÂ vue.config.js. This would enable both syntax transforms and usage-based polyfill detection for that dependency.
  2. If the dependency ships ES5 code and explicitly lists the polyfills needed:Â you can pre-include the needed polyfills using theÂ polyfills (opens new window)Â option forÂ @vue/babel-preset-app.Â Note thatÂ es.promiseÂ is included by default because it's very common for libs to depend on Promises.

GitHub - browserslist/browserslist: ğŸ¦” Share target browsers between different front-end tools, like Autoprefixer, Stylelint and babel-preset-env (opens new window)
